title: William C. Waterhouse

He was a professor emeritus of Mathematics at Pennsylvania State University,[1] after having taught there for over 35 years.[2] The early part of his career was at Cornell University.[2] His research interests included abstract algebra, number theory, group schemes, and the history of mathematics.[3]
